title: ID: Is it a Myriad variation?
content:
[http://blogs.vmware.com/teamfusion/WindowsLiveWriter/screen\_final\_3.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706173728/http:/blogs.vmware.com/teamfusion/WindowsLiveWriter/screen_final_3.jpg "http://blogs.vmware.com/teamfusion/WindowsLiveWriter/screen\_final\_3.jpg")

When you type “Macs” with Myriad is the same thing that appears in the image.. but FUSION is quite different.. specially the S. The S of Myriad is less ’modulated’.

Anymaster know what type is this?

 [‹ Type ID.](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706173728/http:/www.typophile.com/node/44918 "Go to previous forum topic") [Mysterious Musical Symbol ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706173728/http:/www.typophile.com/node/44528 "Go to next forum topic")
author: cesarkohl

comments.content:
You have Myriad on the left  
 [http://store1.adobe.com/cfusion/store/html/index.cfm?store=OLS-US&event=...](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706173728/http:/store1.adobe.com/cfusion/store/html/index.cfm?store=OLS-US&event=displayFontPackage&code=1706 "http://store1.adobe.com/cfusion/store/html/index.cfm?store=OLS-US&event=displayFontPackage&code=1706")

and

you have Interstate Bold on the right:  
 [http://www.fontbureau.com/fonts/Interstate/styles](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706173728/http:/www.fontbureau.com/fonts/Interstate/styles "http://www.fontbureau.com/fonts/Interstate/styles")

Mikey :-)
